extent.charseq: US Secretary of State Colin Powell
A spokeswoman for Europe's biggest airline
A spokeswoman for Europe's biggest airline
A spokeswoman for Europe's biggest airline

A spokeswoman for Europe's biggest airline said the decision to stop using hotels in Riyadh and Jeddah and instead lodge crew in Larnaca, Cyprus was taken after the British Foreign Office advised on Tuesday against non-essential travel to Saudi Arabia

Our cabin and flight crews will stay overnight in Larnaca as they did during the (Iraq) war," said the spokeswoman, adding that BA would continue direct flights to both Saudi cities from London, but return flights would be via Larnaca

At least 34 people, including up to 10 Americans, were killed Monday night when suspected al-Qaeda suicide bombers shot their way into housing compounds in Riyadh, hours before US Secretary of State Colin Powell was due to visit
blasts in the Saudi capital of Riyadh

ldc_scope.charseq: British Airways (BA) announced on Wednesday it had canceled stopovers for its air crews in Saudi Arabia following a change in the British government's travel advice after the suicide blasts in the Saudi capital of Riyadh

extent.charseq: A Briton was confirmed dead from the suicide bombings, during which another 15 Britons, including a 15-year-old girl
